perturbation.original_text: 1.8 Where a SCHEDULE provides that CERES will make a financial contribution to certain RESEARCH PROJECT activities performed by IGER,  unless agreed otherwise in the appropriate SCHEDULE, IGER will submit invoices after the end of each calendar quarter for the work performed  during that quarter. Each such invoice shall reflect only those costs that have been incurred in performance of the RESEARCH PROJECT and shall  provide a breakdown of costs similar to the detail set forth in the budget of the related SCHEDULE. CERES will pay all such invoices within thirty  (30) days after the invoice date.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.8 Where a SCHEDULE provides that CERES will make a financial contribution to certain RESEARCH PROJECT activities performed by IGER,  unless agreed otherwise in the appropriate SCHEDULE, IGER will submit invoices after the end of each calendar quarter for the work performed  during that quarter. Each such invoice shall reflect only those costs that have been incurred in performance of the RESEARCH PROJECT and shall  provide a breakdown of costs similar to the detail set forth in the budget of the related SCHEDULE. CERES will pay all such invoices within sixty (60) days after the invoice date.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces an in-text contradiction regarding the payment deadline for invoices. The original text specifies a payment term of thirty (30) days, while the modified text extends this period to sixty (60) days. This inconsistency creates uncertainty and potential disputes over which deadline is applicable, affecting the enforcement of payment terms.

perturbation.original_text: 1.8 Where a SCHEDULE provides that CERES will make a financial contribution to certain RESEARCH PROJECT activities performed by IGER,  unless agreed otherwise in the appropriate SCHEDULE, IGER will submit invoices after the end of each calendar quarter for the work performed  during that quarter. Each such invoice shall reflect only those costs that have been incurred in performance of the RESEARCH PROJECT and shall  provide a breakdown of costs similar to the detail set forth in the budget of the related SCHEDULE. CERES will pay all such invoices within thirty  (30) days after the invoice date.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.8 Where a SCHEDULE provides that CERES will make a financial contribution to certain RESEARCH PROJECT activities performed by IGER,  unless agreed otherwise in the appropriate SCHEDULE, IGER will submit invoices after the end of each calendar quarter for the work performed  during that quarter. Each such invoice shall reflect only those costs that have been incurred in performance of the RESEARCH PROJECT and shall  provide a breakdown of costs similar to the detail set forth in the budget of the related SCHEDULE. CERES will pay all such invoices within thirty (30) days after receipt of the invoice.
perturbation.explanation: This alteration generates an in-text conflict by changing the payment trigger from the 'invoice date' to the 'receipt of the invoice'. This creates ambiguity regarding when the payment timeline begins, potentially delaying payments and increasing disputes over adherence to payment terms.

perturbation.original_text: 5.3.1 Subject to Articles 5.1 and 5.2, the Parties acknowledge and agree that CERES shall have the exclusive right, with the right to grant  sublicenses to this right, to use and commercially exploit JOINT INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY (including but not limited to RELEASED  VARIETIES) and OTHER RESEARCH RESULTS for any and all uses and fields, including, but not limited to, use in the COLLABORATION  CROPS and crops other than the COLLABORATION CROPS. Any commercialization (including, but not limited to, the grant of  commercialization licenses) of JOINT INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY and/or OTHER RESEARCH RESULTS shall result in CERES paying IGER a  reasonable remuneration (whether as a royalty or in some other form as the Parties may agree) to be negotiated in good faith. The terms for  remuneration will be specified, with respect to specific RESEARCH PROJECTS, JOINT INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY and/or OTHER  RESEARCH RESULTS, either in the respective SCHEDULES or in other agreements to be executed by the Parties.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.3.1 Subject to Articles 5.1 and 5.2, the Parties acknowledge and agree that CERES shall have the exclusive right, with the right to grant  sublicenses to this right, to use and commercially exploit JOINT INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY (including but not limited to RELEASED  VARIETIES) and OTHER RESEARCH RESULTS for any and all uses and fields, including, but not limited to, use in the COLLABORATION  CROPS and crops other than the COLLABORATION CROPS. Any commercialization (including, but not limited to, the grant of  commercialization licenses) of JOINT INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY and/or OTHER RESEARCH RESULTS shall result in CERES paying IGER a  reasonable remuneration (whether as a royalty or in some other form as the Parties may agree) to be determined unilaterally by CERES. The terms for  remuneration will be specified, with respect to specific RESEARCH PROJECTS, JOINT INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY and/or OTHER  RESEARCH RESULTS, either in the respective SCHEDULES or in other agreements to be executed by the Parties.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction related to the determination of remuneration for IGER. The original text specifies that CERES will pay IGER a reasonable remuneration to be negotiated in good faith. However, the modified text states that the remuneration will be determined unilaterally by CERES. This creates ambiguity and conflicts regarding the process and fairness of setting the remuneration, potentially leading to disputes over commercialization rights and financial obligations.
